title: Two Sum
description: Given an array of integers, return the indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. You can return the answer in any order.
input_format: An array of integers nums and an integer target.
output_format: An array of two integers representing the indices of the two numbers that add up to target.
constraints: target is a valid integer within the range.

examples.explanation: nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9, thus the indices are 0 and 1.
nums[1] + nums[2] = 2 + 4 = 6, thus the indices are 1 and 2.

hints: Use a hash map to store the difference of each number and the target.
Iterate through the array and check if current number's complement exists in the map.

title: Merge Sorted Array
description: You are given two integer arrays nums1 and nums2, sorted in non-decreasing order, and two integers m and n representing the number of elements in nums1 and nums2 respectively. Merge nums2 into nums1 as one sorted array.
input_format: Two integer arrays nums1 and nums2, followed by two integers m and n.
output_format: The modified nums1 array, which now contains all elements in sorted order.

examples.explanation: Since nums2 is empty, nums1 remains unchanged.
All elements from nums2 are added to nums1.

hints: Consider using two pointers to traverse both arrays.
Start filling nums1 from the end to avoid overwriting.
Make sure to copy any remaining elements from nums2.

title: Reverse Words in a String III
description: Given a string s, you need to reverse the order of characters in each word within a sentence while still preserving whitespace and initial word order.
input_format: A single string s containing words separated by spaces.
output_format: A string with each word reversed while preserving spaces.
constraints: s consists of printable ASCII characters.

examples.explanation: Each word is reversed: 'Let's' becomes 's'teL', 'take' becomes 'ekat', and so on.
Reversing each word results in 'olleH' and 'dlroW'.

hints: Consider splitting the input string by spaces.
Reverse each individual word and join them back together.
